alert.note: Alert for Central Highlands; Sandia and Manzano Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 15 at 4:06AM MDT until April 15 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THROUGH 6 PM TODAY FOR THE SANDIA AND MANZANO MOUNTAINS AS WELL AS THE CENTRAL HIGHLANDS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Critical fire weather conditions will redevelop today across the Sandia and Manzano Mountains as well as the Central Highlands. Strong northwest winds will develop behind a cold front and though temperatures are not expected to be as high as yesterday, dewpoints will lower considerably. Thus, several hours of single digit humidity values are expected today. Winds will decrease late in the afternoon to alleviate the critical fire weather concerns. However, widespread critical fire weather conditions are possible again mid week. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 6 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * AREA AND TIMING...Central Highlands (Zone 125) and the Sandia and Manzano Mountains (Zone 124) below significant snowpack from 10 AM this morning until 6 PM MDT this evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Northwest 20 to 30 mph with occasional gusts to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...7 to 13 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Central Highlands; Sandia and Manzano Mountains
